conclusion: Basketball dropped from height H, rebounds to height h, air resistance proportional to gravitational force.
Proportionality constant λ given, need to find ratio of post-collision to pre-collision velocity.
Ball dropped from rest, initial velocity zero, gravity accelerates downward, air resistance upward.
Ball rebounds to height h, ratio of rebound velocity to impact velocity constant.
Define vi as velocity before impact, vr as velocity after rebound, seek ratio vr/vi.
Air resistance λ times gravitational force, λ < (H-h)/(H+h), consider effects during fall and rise.
Net force during fall is mg(1-λ) downward, acceleration a = g(1-λ).
Net acceleration during rise is mg(1+λ) downward.
Condition λ < (H-h)/(H+h) given, check if it affects result.
Condition ensures physical constraints, ratio real and positive.
